# Disadvantaged Community Water Grants (2026)

## What is a Disadvantaged Community?

### Disadvantaged Community (DAC)
- Median Household Income (MHI) < 80% of statewide MHI
- Statewide MHI varies annually
- Check current thresholds with State Water Board

### Severely Disadvantaged Community (SDAC)
- MHI < 60% of statewide MHI
- Higher priority for funding
- More grant/forgiveness available

## How to Determine DAC Status

### Online Tools
- [DAC Mapping Tool](https://gis.water.ca.gov/app/dacs/) -- enter address or census tract
- Shows DAC and SDAC designations

### Census Data
- Based on American Community Survey
- Census tract or block group level
- Updated periodically

## Grant Programs for DACs

### SAFER Program
- Priority for DAC/SDAC communities through the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/)
- Grants for construction, TA, O&M
- No repayment required

### DWSRF Principal Forgiveness
- Portion (or all) of loan forgiven through the [DWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/drinking_water/services/funding/SRF.html)
- Effectively becomes a grant
- For small DAC/SDAC systems

### CWSRF Principal Forgiveness
- Similar structure to DWSRF through the [CWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/srf/)
- For wastewater/stormwater projects
- ~$514 million available FY 2025-26

### Technical Assistance
- Free TA for DAC communities
- Planning, engineering, legal
- Training and capacity building

## Bipartisan Infrastructure Law Funding

### Federal Requirements
- 49% of supplemental SRF funds as principal forgiveness/grants
- Targeted to disadvantaged communities
- Substantial increase in DAC funding

### Lead Service Line Replacement
- Federal funding for lead pipe removal
- Priority to impacted communities
- No income test for lead projects

## Benefits for DAC Applicants

### Priority Scoring
- Higher priority on fundable lists
- Faster processing in some cases
- Dedicated staff support

### Reduced Cost Share
- Often 100% grant funding
- No local match required
- Lower (or zero) interest rates

### Extended Terms
- Longer repayment periods
- Up to 40 years for some programs
- Zero interest available

## Application Tips for DACs

### Step 1: Confirm DAC Status
- Use [DAC Mapping Tool](https://gis.water.ca.gov/app/dacs/)
- Document for application

### Step 2: Contact DFA Early
- Discuss available options
- Get application guidance
- Phone: (916) 341-5700

### Step 3: Request Technical Assistance
- Free help available
- For application development
- For project planning

### Step 4: Emphasize DAC Benefits
- Highlight community need
- Document public health issues
- Show how project helps residents

## Take Action

1. **Check your DAC status** -- Use the [DAC Mapping Tool](https://gis.water.ca.gov/app/dacs/) to see if your community qualifies as a Disadvantaged or Severely Disadvantaged Community.
2. **Explore SAFER grants** -- Visit the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/) page for grant funding available to DAC/SDAC communities for construction, operations, and technical assistance.
3. **Apply for DWSRF financing** -- Check the [DWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/drinking_water/services/funding/SRF.html) for principal forgiveness options that effectively convert loans to grants for small DAC systems.
4. **Review CWSRF options** -- Visit the [CWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/srf/) page for wastewater and stormwater project funding with principal forgiveness for disadvantaged communities.
5. **Contact Financial Assistance** -- Call (916) 341-5700 to discuss your community's eligibility, available grant programs, and get help preparing your application.
